sub_title: Program Director & Science Lead | Data enthusiast
summary: In my role as a Solution Innovator, I catalyze transformation in a sector that touches countless lives daily. My responsibility centers on fostering positive shifts within the pharmaceutical landscape. By delving into emerging trends, I pinpoint avenues ripe for innovation. Working alongside scientists and engineers, we bring tangible solutions to life and ensure their seamless integration. My background in healthcare validation equips me to extract vital data on the effectiveness and safety of potential treatments, going beyond the constraints of conventional clinical trials. This approach accelerates the release of new medical solutions to the public in a streamlined and impactful way. My journey ahead is centered on harnessing novel technologies and data-centric methodologies to enhance healthcare results.

profile_positions.description:
Innovation: Driving innovation in RNA editing technologies, approaches, and therapeutic applications. Deep understanding of Drug intelligence discovery that leverages data analysis and AI to identify potential new pharmaceutical compounds and accelerate drug development. Implementing innovative strategies within the company.

   Research Leadership: Providing direction and oversight for the company's scientific research, ensuring it aligns with its strategic objectives. This includes developing and implementing research strategies and methodologies.

    Team Management: Overseeing the work of scientists, researchers, and other technical staff. This involves mentoring and developing scientific staff, managing team dynamics, and recruiting new talent.

    Project Management: Directing and managing scientific projects, which may include the development and optimization of RNA editing technologies, preclinical studies, clinical trials, and regulatory submissions.

    Collaboration and Partnership: Collaborating with other departments within the company, as well as external partners, to facilitate the translation of scientific discoveries into therapeutic applications.

    Regulatory Compliance: Ensuring the company's scientific activities comply with relevant regulatory standards and ethical guidelines. This may involve working closely with the company's regulatory affairs and quality assurance teams.

    Communication: Communicating the scientific progress to leadership, investors, regulators, and the scientific community via reports, presentations, and research publications.

    Budget Management: Overseeing the budget for research and development activities, making sure that resources are used effectively and efficiently.

    Risk Management: Identifying potential scientific and technical risks and developing and implementing strategies to mitigate these risks.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Director

profile_positions.description:
Bridging the gap between research and development (R&D) and marketing teams, transforming analytical insights into actionable strategies that drive business growth. 

Leading effective implementation of new technologies in drug discovery and development through partnerships with international pharmaceutical companies.

Coordinating projects between R&D, regulatory, clinical operations, and marketing teams to revolutionize drug discovery and development, benefiting patients and healthcare providers worldwide.

As a project manager, key achievements include:

Serving as the primary point of contact for clients, demonstrating strong customer focus, and fostering relationships with client project teams. This approach has led to the successful completion of goals within record timeframes.

Developing project plans and schedules to ensure timely achievement of milestones. This includes conducting kick-off meetings and coordinating cross-functional teamwork among R&D, technical support, supply chain, quality operations, design quality, regulatory affairs, and marketing teams.

Notable projects led and coordinated include:

"Non-alcoholic fatty liver disease as a cause of sarcopenia"
"Micro-l-AI-ver: Artificial intelligence-powered drug screening platform for 3D-bioprinted human liver microspheres"
"AI-powered assistant for the real-time detection of depression"
As a principal scientist, key achievements include:

Securing the Knowledge Industry Programme 201 grant from AGAUR for the BioLiver Assist Device (BLAD) project. The primary objective of this project is to complete the in vitro validation of the artificial liver.

Obtaining the 7th call CERCAGínjol Patents Fund for the Uniink project, reflecting the innovative potential of the research.

Securing an international multi-layered Cell Capsules for Cell Implantation (PCT patent filed on September 10th, 2019, P5043PC00 to European Patent Office).
profile_positions.title: Senior Scientist Project Lead

company.name: Institut d’Investigacions Biomèdiques August Pi i Sunyer (IDIBAPS)

profile_positions.company: Institut d’Investigacions Biomèdiques August Pi i Sunyer (IDIBAPS)
profile_positions.description:
As an External Scientific Collaboration Manager in R&D, I controlled the overall process for external scientific collaborations, ensuring compliance with SOPs, and maximizing value delivery. My experience included managing interactions with external scientific partners, sharing responsibility for project execution and delivery, and working within a cross-functional matrix setting.

Key Responsibilities and Achievements:

Single point of contact for assigned External Scientific Collaborations, streamlining communication and ensuring effective stakeholder coordination.

Engaged with Business Owners to secure strategic intent and alignment for new collaboration requests, ultimately obtaining Leadership team approval.

Spearheaded coordination with supporting functions, ensuring timely information collection and implementation of project steps according to written standards.

Developed a comprehensive understanding of cost drivers in external collaborations, reviewing budget requests from external collaborators to optimize resource allocation.

Monitored collaboration execution, identified potential risks, and implemented preventive or mitigation measures in coordination with Partners and Business Owners.

Collaborated with contracting teams to trigger amendments/revisions as needed, maintaining compliance with contractual terms.

Contributed to leadership reporting and established efficient procedures to comply with audit requests, maintaining a high level of transparency.

Acted as Primary Point of Contact for collaborations, fostering effective working relationships and facilitating communication between internal and external parties.

Worked closely with external partners, Business Owners/Project Leads, and other key stakeholders (e.g., BD, IP, Legal) to achieve mutual strategic objectives and continuously generate value within collaborations.
profile_positions.title: R&D Scientific Collaboration Manager

profile_positions.description:
I specialized in investigating innovative treatment strategies, conducting comprehensive data analyses, and delivering value-driving solutions to clients in various stages of analytics maturity.

Key Projects and Expertise:

Investigated Yaq-001 as a therapeutic strategy for Acute-on-Chronic Liver Failure (ACLF) and Non-alcoholic Liver Steatohepatitis (NASH), contributing to the advancement of liver disease treatment options.

Conducted RNA-seq analysis on human and animal liver samples using cutting-edge technology, such as Illumina HiSeq, Roche 454, and SOLiD equipment, ensuring high-quality data for further analysis.

Performed differential gene expression analysis using RStudio, identifying dysregulated processes and potential therapeutic targets in liver disease.

Utilized QIAGEN Ingenuity Pathway Analysis (IPA) to explore dysregulated pathways, enhancing the understanding of underlying molecular mechanisms in liver diseases.

Confirmed the results of RNA-seq and pathway analyses using qPCR with Taqman chemistry, validating the accuracy and reliability of the findings.

Key Achievements:

Successfully shaped, presented, and delivered analytic solutions for clients at various stages of analytics maturity, demonstrating adaptability and a commitment to client satisfaction.

Established a proven track record of delivering pragmatic and value-driving solutions, contributing to the progress of liver disease research and therapeutic development.

I was committed to understanding liver disease mechanisms and contributing to the development of novel therapeutic strategies. My experience in advanced data analysis techniques, combined with a strong scientific background, enables me to deliver high-quality, value-driven solutions for clients in the field of liver disease research.
profile_positions.title: Research Consultant & Data scientist

Associate Scientist:
 	Leader of the project “Ammonia as target for treatment in patients with Acute-on-Chronic liver failure”.
 	Grant proposal writing (from cover letter to budget).

Visiting Ph.D. Student

company.name: Università degli Studi di Napoli Federico II

profile_positions.company: Università degli Studi di Napoli Federico II
profile_positions.description:
Duties
My PhD research was focused on the importance of human genetic resistance against the infection of Mycobacterium tuberculosis. 
Manipulation, storage, and processing of human blood samples from patients with pulmonary tuberculosis from collaboration with Monaldi Hospital, reference centre for tuberculosis in Italy. 
Genetic and epigenetic analysis of single nucleotide polymorphisms of two genes, MyD88 and TIRAP, involved in the immune response to the Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Statistical analyses including the calculation of ODDs ratio using Fisher’s exact test between control and cases, sample size, Hardy–Weinberg equilibrium, Mantel–Haenszel test, logistic regression analysis coupled with bootstrap resampling, Generalized Linear Model procedure, and the univariate ANOVA with Tuckey’s HSD post hoc test. 

Achievements
I defended my PhD thesis after 3 years of research. 
I have published 3 scientific articles as second author.
profile_positions.title: Doctoral Student

volunteer_experiences.description:
Tissue engineering addresses the fabrication of functional three-dimensional structures that resemble the native organ. It is a transversal field that includes engineered cells, and engineered tissues, aiming to re-create, replace, and restore a whole or partial organ. As a dynamic field, tissue engineering constantly evolves and integrates new research areas such as nanotechnology and 3D printing.

According to the PubMed database, over 150 000 papers on tissue engineering have been published in the last 30 years. However, few of the proposed solutions ended in real-world applications. Many projects suffer from technical limitations such as the inability to reproduce native mechanical properties, cellular complexity, safety, and the lifespan of tissue engineering products. With the correct feedback and investors, it is possible to ensure that promising ideas have clinical application. This Special Issue aims to provide more visibility to proof-of-concept studies in order to receive feedback from the scientific community.

Targeting cutting-edge research in tissue engineering may help find new ways to tackle important health conditions in terms of their diagnosis, treatment, and prevention.

https://www.mdpi.com/journal/biomedicines/special_issues/Tissue_Engineer
